Titulo: Structure and conductivity investigations of alkaline earth substituted uranium oxide, U1-xMxO2±δ (M=Mg, Ca, Sr) for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: /-delta ; M=Mg, Ca, Sr; 0.1 <= x <= 0.525) with fluorite structure was synthesized in reducing atmosphere.
Titulo: Structure and conductivity investigations of alkaline earth substituted uranium oxide, U1-xMxO2±δ (M=Mg, Ca, Sr) for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Structure and conductivity properties of U1-xMxO2 +/-delta fluorites were investigated for possible application in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Structure and conductivity investigations of alkaline earth substituted uranium oxide, U1-xMxO2±δ (M=Mg, Ca, Sr) for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: At room temperature and ambient atmosphere the materials are stable; however they decompose at an oxygen partial pressure po(2) > 10(-4) aim and temperatures higher than 600 degrees C.
Titulo: Structure and conductivity investigations of alkaline earth substituted uranium oxide, U1-xMxO2±δ (M=Mg, Ca, Sr) for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The total conductivity measured for the best conducting U1-xMXO2 +/-delta material with M=Ca and x=0.177 is as high as 3 S/cm at po(2) < 10(-4) aim at 600 degrees C.
Titulo: Structure and conductivity investigations of alkaline earth substituted uranium oxide, U1-xMxO2±δ (M=Mg, Ca, Sr) for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The relatively low ionic transference number (t(i)similar to 0.02) is disadvantageous for potential use as electrolyte material for SOFC applications.
Titulo: Structure and conductivity investigations of alkaline earth substituted uranium oxide, U1-xMxO2±δ (M=Mg, Ca, Sr) for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The high conductivity and possible depolarization effects suggest potential use as anode materials in SOFC.
Titulo: Structure and conductivity investigations of alkaline earth substituted uranium oxide, U1-xMxO2±δ (M=Mg, Ca, Sr) for solid oxide fuel cell applications
